physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal apart from periodic bradycardic episodes.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Notably hypotonic; no facial dysmorphology or obvious musculoskeletal abnormalities.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum ionized calcium 1.99 mmol/L (normal: 1 to 1.17 mmol/L), serum total calcium 3.23 mmol/L (normal: 2.33 to 2.74 mmol/L), serum magnesium 1.1 mmol/L (normal: 0.62 to 1.03 mmol/L), serum phosphorus 0.94 mmol/L (normal: 1.55 to 2.65 mmol/L), 25-hydroxyvitamin D low at 10.9 nmol/L (normal: 32 to 80 nmol/L), intact PTH 1154 pg/mL (normal: <160 pg/mL), fractional excretion of calcium 0.003 (normal: >0.01).
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Diffuse demineralization and multiple healing rib fractures observed on chest radiograph; elevated serum ionized calcium and intact PTH.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially treated with iv saline without significant effect on serum calcium level.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal after treatment with cinacalcet, overall clinical condition improved significantly.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Muscle tone improved; initially significant bradycardia and hypotonia resolved with treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's serum calcium levels normalized with cinacalcet therapy, improving overall clinical condition.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcium increased to 3.63 mmol/L, intact PTH 78.8 pg/mL.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Developed hypotonia along with periodic apnea and bradycardia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Severe gastroenteritis led to difficulties tolerating oral medications, increasing serum calcium level.

physical_examinations.date: Throughout the first 18 months of life
physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcium levels intermittently elevated despite treatment.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient did not require bisphosphonate therapy or surgical intervention; skeletal survey continued to show improvement.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistence of mild hypercalcemia; however, no significant symptoms of hypercalcemia developed.
